server.name: memory-daemon
server.description: Memory management HTTP daemon service for storing and retrieving important information across conversations

tools.name: memory_remember
tools.description: üíæ REMEMBER information that should be recalled later. Use this to store facts, preferences, context, or any important information. Example: memory_remember with content='User lives in Berlin' and key='location'

content.description: The information to remember. Be specific and detailed. Examples: 'User prefers dark mode', 'User lives in Berlin', 'Project uses React and TypeScript', 'User's favorite color is blue'

key.description: Category or tag for organizing memories. Examples: 'user-preferences', 'location', 'project-info', 'personal-facts', 'work-context'

metadata.description: Additional context like importance level, tags, expiration date, etc.

userId.description: User ID (optional, defaults to current user)

tools.name: memory_recall
tools.description: üß† RECALL previously stored memories. Use this to retrieve information that was stored earlier. Search by content text or filter by key category.

key.description: Find memories with specific category/tag. Examples: 'location', 'user-preferences', 'project-info'

search.description: Search for memories containing specific text. Examples: 'Berlin', 'dark mode', 'React', 'favorite color'

limit.description: Maximum number of memories to return (1-100, default 50)

offset.description: Number of memories to skip (for pagination, default 0)

userId.description: User ID (optional, defaults to current user)

tools.name: memory_reset
tools.description: üóëÔ∏è DELETE stored memories. Use with caution! Can delete all memories or just those with a specific key.

key.description: Only delete memories with this specific key/category. If not provided, deletes ALL memories for the user!

userId.description: User ID (optional, defaults to current user)

resources.name: Memory Statistics
resources.description: Current memory usage statistics, categories, and stored information overview
